properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 7 at 3:43AM AKST until February 9 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Very cold wind chills occuring. Blizzard conditions
possible late tonight through Saturday evening. Expect wind
chills as cold as 50 below zero. Total snow accumulations of 1
to 3 inches, with localized amounts up to 5 inches, are
possible.

* WHERE...Yukon Delta.

* WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, now to 3 AM Saturday. For
the Winter Storm Watch, from late tonight through Saturday
evening.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cold wind chills will cause frostbite
in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Winds gusting as
high as 50 mph may cause widespread blowing and drifting snow
along with whiteout conditions.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind
speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite
and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for blizzard
conditions that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest
forecasts.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM AKST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING
